body: Sheep, Coffee, Rugs and Turquoise  The squeaky wooden floor greets your entry into the oldest operating trading post on the Navajo Nation.  When your eyes adjust to the dim light in the "bullpen" you find you’ve just entered a mercantile.  Hubbell's has been serving Ganado selling groceries, grain, hardware, horse tack, coffee and Native American Art since 1878.  Discover Hubbell Trading Post NHS, where history is made every day.                Pueblo Colorado Wash   Pueblo Colorado Wash was one of the main reasons John Lorenzo Hubbell built his homestead and trading post.        Hubbell Homestead today   The landscape of Hubbell Trading Post looks different today as it did over hundred years ago.
title: Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site: Park Home
